action.action-desc: Mr. McKinley (for himself and Mrs. Axne) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require the Director of the National Institutes of Health to conduct an evaluation of menopause-related research (including gaps in research and knowledge regarding the causes, symptoms, and treatments for menopause), to develop a strategic plan to resolve gaps in knowledge and research, and identify topics in need of further research relating to potential treatments for menopause-related symptoms, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Menopause Research Act of 2022.

subsection.text: The Director of the National Institutes of Health shall—

subparagraph.text: the results of completed menopause-related research, and research on mid-life women’s health;
the status of ongoing menopause-related research, and research on mid-life women’s health; and
any gaps in knowledge and research on—

clause.text: the safety and effectiveness of treatments for menopause-related symptoms; and

paragraph.text: as part of such evaluation, identify the total amount of funding allocated by the National Institutes of Health for the conduct or support of menopause-related research, and research on mid-life women’s health over the preceding 5 fiscal years.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the National Institutes of Health shall submit to the Congress—

paragraph.text: a report on the findings of such evaluation; and

subparagraph.text: to resolve the gaps in knowledge and research identified in the report; and
to identify topics in need of further research relating to potential treatments for menopause-related symptoms.

section.header: Menopause-related research, and research on mid-life women’s health

subsection.text: The Secretary of Health and Human Services, acting through the Director of the National Institutes of Health, shall conduct or support menopause-related research, and research on mid-life women’s health.
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $100,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 and 2024.
